creditline: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. John E. Larkin, Jr. in memory of Harold Joachim
provenance: The artist, New York (until d. 1925); his wife, Emma S. Bellows, New York (1925-d. 1959); estate of Emma S. Bellows; [H.V. Allison & Co., New York; sold to Larkin]; John and Colles Larkin, Dellwood, Minnesota (until 1983; given to MIA).
signed: LR: [Geo Bellows] and by the artist\'s daughter: [J.B.B.] (Jean Bellows Booth)
text: This women’s animated but unnatural pose may stem from George Bellows’s interest in Dynamic Symmetry, a means of constructing compositions using mathematical rules. After making a serious study of the rules, Bellows told Robert Henri that he found them more valuable than the study of anatomy.
title: Nude Standing: Seen from Back
